alert.note: Alert for Orange (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 03 at 2:43PM PDT until September 03 at 5:45PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Diego has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Orange County in southwestern California... * Until 545 PM PDT. * At 243 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.75 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mission Viejo, Rancho Santa Margarita, Trabuco Canyon, El Toro, eastern Silverado, Trabuco Highlands, Coto De Caza and Portola Hills. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
